name: catenator
short_description: A Python tool for concatenating code files from a directory into a single output string.
long_description: Catenator is a command-line utility and Python library that concatenates code files from a specified directory into a single output string. It supports multiple programming languages, can generate directory tree structures, include README files, and filter files using gitignore-style .catignore patterns or YAML-based build configurations. It provides options for clipboard output, file watching, token counting, and flexible inclusion/exclusion of file types. Useful for preparing codebases for analysis by language models, documentation generation, or code review.

modules.description: Package initialization that exports the Catenator class and defines project metadata (version, author, description).
Core module containing the Catenator class and CLI implementation for concatenating code files with filtering, tree generation, file watching, and token counting capabilities.
Unit tests covering default concatenation, tree generation, extension filtering, .catignore parsing, build configurations, and token counting.
Package setup configuration defining dependencies (pyperclip, watchdog, pyyaml, tiktoken), entry points, and distribution metadata.
